subject: Re: [junit] Re: Thou shalt write isolated tests
msgSnippet: ... No... I think Ashcroft used to be called something else, but I can t remember what it was called. Maybe I m wrong... -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger ::
messageBody:
Eugene Kuleshov wrote:
> J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
> >> BTW, for those haven't seen it yet, there is a nice rule enforcement
> >> tool for things like that called Ashcroft -
> >> http://docs.codehaus.org/display/ASH/Home I believe it would nicely
> >> work with TestNG too. ;-)
> >>
> > I didn't know it had changed names. I like the new name. Cute.
> >
> If you thought of Guantanamo, it is a different tool and it is still
> there. Otherwise I am not sure what are you talking about.

No... I think Ashcroft used to be called something else, but I can't
remember what it was called. Maybe I'm wrong...
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
